title: Alabama inmate sentenced to life after escaping with assistance from jail official who took her own life
description: An inmate from Alabama was given a life sentence after successfully escaping with the help of a jail official who tragically ended her own life as police closed in on them.

title: IN nursing home resident, 61, pleads guilty to raping, murdering 80-year-old invalid
description: Dwayne Freeman, 61, of Indianapolis, has pleaded guilty to raping and killing Patricia Newnum, 80, at the nursing home where they both resided.

title: Disgraced Cleveland dance instructor gets life for raping, abusing underage students
description: Terence Greene, a once-acclaimed dance instructor who launched several Broadway performers' careers, was sentenced to life in prison for raping six students and sexually assaulting two.

title: New York's legal bid to redraw House map could decide control of chamber
description: A Democrat-backed lawsuit claiming New York's current court-ordered congressional map is unfair could hold serious sway over next year's elections.

title: Kosovo accuses US, EU of pro-Serbian bias in negotiations
description: Kosovar Prime Minister Albin Kurti on Thursday complained of alleged bias by the United States and other Western nations in negotiations with Serbia.

title: Texas to deploy inflatable border along Rio Grande River in Eagle Pass
description: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott announced a six-bill package to bolster border security efforts, adding that a 1,000-foot inflatable barrier was being deployed in Eagle Pass.

title: Trump indicted on federal charges related to document handling and obstruction of justice
description: Former President Trump says he has been indicted on federal charges out of Special Counsel Jack Smith’s months-long investigation.

title: Broncos sign two-time Super Bowl champ Frank Clark to one-year deal: report
description: The Kansas City Chiefs will have to face a familiar defensive lineman this season after Frank Clark reportedly signed a one-year deal with the Denver Broncos.

title: Sean Hannity to interview Gavin Newsom in CA governor's first Fox News appearance since 2010
description: Fox News host Sean Hannity is set to interview California Gov. Gavin Newsom to discuss a broad range if issues set to air Monday, June 12 at 9 p.m. ET on "Hannity."

title: Pentagon says it does not support drag shows on military installations: 'longstanding policy'
description: The Department of Defense spokesman said Thursday the DOD does not support hosting drag shows at military installations and facilities.

title: Americans identifying as socially, economically conservative hits highest point in more than a decade: poll
description: A new Gallup poll has found that more Americans are now identifying as socially and economically conservative than at any point since 2012.

description: San Diego police are looking for a suspect considered "armed and dangerous" who they say shot an officer late Thursday morning. Residents were told to shelter in place.

title: Shannen Doherty 'doing OK' after revealing cancer has spread to her brain; celebrity friends show support
description: Shannen Doherty's representative told Fox News Digital that the actress is "doing OK." Doherty revealed Tuesday that her cancer had spread to her brain.

description: New Mexico has initiated its first ever campaign to promote responsible use of recreational marijuana, more than a year after its legalization. The campaign includes billboards, and TV.

title: San Diego charter school teachers voted to leave union: There will be 'a lot more joy' in classrooms

title: Shaquille O'Neal spotted at dinner with model Brittany Renner at same spot as wedding with ex-wife
description: NBA legend Shaquille O'Neal was spotted at dinner with internet celebrity Brittany Renner at the Beverly Hills Hotel, the location of his wedding with ex-wife Shaunie.

title: Alabama governor signs bill designating official state cookie, the creation of a talented 4th grader
description: Alabama designated the "Yellowhammer Cookie" as its official state cookie, after hard work from an intrepid 4th-grade class in Montgomery. Here are details about the sweet treat.

title: Biden rails against 'hysterical,' 'prejudiced' lawmakers banning child gender surgery: 'We are not relenting'
description: President Biden railed against lawmakers pushing state-level bills that ban gender surgery from being performed on children, calling them "hysterical" and "prejudiced."

title: Delaware bills promoting greater public accountability and transparency clears Democratic House committee
description: To better tackle officer misconduct in Delaware, a Democrat-led House committee has approved two measures aimed at providing greater transparency and public accountability.

title: Prosecutors urge Minnesota Supreme Court to reject Derek Chauvin's request to reconsider his conviction
description: Former Minnesota Police Officer Derek Chauvin requested that the state's Supreme Court reconsider his homicide conviction. Prosecutors are urging the state to reject the request.

title: Washington state equity director fired after complaints of racist comments, fat-shaming colleague
description: Washington state's equity director was fired after facing accusations of bias against certain genders and racist comments toward Mexican and Hispanic employees.

title: Native American leaders rebuke Biden admin over oil leasing ban: 'Undermines our sovereignty'
description: The Navajo Nation is aggressively pushing back against the Biden administration's 20-year ban on new oil and gas leasing near an Indigenous cultural site in New Mexico.

title: New York City subway passenger, 50, targeted by teens in ‘gang assault’
description: The NYPD is asking for the public’s assistance in tracking down a group of young suspects wanted for allegedly attacking a 50-year-old man “unprovoked" at a subway station in Brooklyn.

title: Body of Oregon man who went missing spreading ashes of loved one found near wooded area
description: An Oregon man went missing after going to spread a loved one's ashes, only for his body to be found days later, a local sheriff's office announced.

title: Replacement Air India plane carrying American citizens lands in San Francisco after being diverted to Russia
description: An Air India replacement plane that was carrying American citizens had to be diverted to Russia due to an engine problem. The plane has successfully landed in San Francisco.

title: Tour spots 20 killer whales off San Francisco in unusual orca sighting
description: A whale-watching boat tour saw an unusually large group of roughly two dozen orcas off San Francisco, California. Killer whales usually stay together in groups of three to six.

title: 2 federal prisons employees in Virginia indicted for allegedly failing to provide medical care to inmate
description: A grand jury has indicted two U.S. Bureau of Prisons workers for allegedly neglecting an inmate when he was suffering from a serious medical issue.

title: Newlyweds shamed by social media users for advertising Venmo username on car window: 'Why not?'
description: A Reddit post showing a couple advertising their Venmo account on a car window along with the phrase, "just married," sparks debate online. Most say the trending practice is "tacky."

title: Austrian authorities recover train that was stuck in tunnel when fire broke out
description: Rescuers evacuated 151 people on board a train that was stuck in an Austrian tunnel on June 8, 2023. The train is being recovered from the tunnel by authorities in the country.

title: Brain-boosting foods for fighting memory loss, preventing Alzheimer’s disease
description: There are several foods such as berries, spinach and even chocolate that promote healthy brain function. Incorporating these foods into your diet could help your memory.

title: Chris Christie assesses Trump's potential second indictment: 'These are all self-inflicted wounds'
description: Former New Jersey Governor and 2024 presidential candidate Chris Christie (R) joined "Fox & Friends" to discuss Donald Trump's legal challenges and why he calls them self-inflicted.

title: New York woman seen in park rampage video back on the streets as witnesses describe mayhem
description: A disturbed New York woman seen lunging at a baby and attacking others was taken by police but returned to the area the very next day, according to victims.

title: Hostages but no demands: McCarthy says GOP rebels' concerns unclear as floor blockade forces House adjournment
description: House Speaker McCarthy said the House would adjourn until Monday so that he and the GOP rebels who are stalling legislation o the floor could 'work through it'

title: Joan Rivers' daughter thinks mom would find cancel culture ‘very frustrating’: ‘Allow people to evolve’
description: Joan Rivers' daughter, Melissa Rivers, is honoring her mom on what would have been her 90th birthday as she's inducted into the National Comedy Center with her own exhibit.

title: Nuggets duo makes NBA history in Finals win: 'Their greatest performance'
description: Denver Nuggets teammates Nikola Jokic and Jamal Murray made NBA history on Wednesday, becoming the first duo to record 30-point triple-doubles in a game.

title: New York county struggles with influx of migrants from NYC exacerbating homelessness crisis
description: New York counties describe how a potential influx of asylum seekers from New York City will affect housing and put a strain on their resources.

title: Here's our plan to sink Biden's war on household appliances
description: I’m an attorney general and I’m going to sink Biden’s war on household appliances. His Energy Department tries huge power grab to abuse green regulations.

title: House Homeland Republicans to launch probe into Mayorkas’ ‘dereliction of duty’ in handling border crisis
description: The House Homeland Security Committee will hold a hearing on an alleged 'dereliction of duty' by DHS Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas over the crisis at the southern border.

title: Oklahoma shuts out Florida State in Game 1 of WCWS behind Jordy Bahl's dominant outing
description: Oklahoma Sooners' pitcher Jordy Bahl led the Sooners to victory over Florida State with a dominant pitching performance. The Sooners are a win away from their third consecutive title.

title: West Ham wins Europa Conference League Final, ending 58-year drought with victory over Fiorentina
description: West Ham won their first European trophy in 58 years with their victory over Fiorentina in the Europa Conference League Final on Wednesday night.

title: Iowa woman whose leg was amputated after being injured in Davenport apartment collapse files lawsuit
description: A lawsuit has been filed by the woman whose leg had to be amputated after she was injured in the Davenport, Iowa, apartment building collapse.

title: Joran van der Sloot case: FBI leaves Peru with Natalee Holloway suspect to face charges in US: source
description: A plane carrying Joran van der Sloot and agents from the FBI are en route to Alabama, where the prime Natalee Holloway suspect will face federal charges.

title: 2 Georgia women wounded in carnival shooting that sent families running
description: Police in Alpharetta, Georgia, are searching for a suspect after two women were shot at the North Point Mall Carnival on Wednesday night.

title: Christian UK doctor fired for refusing to use trans pronouns again appealing case
description: A Christian doctor in the U.K. lost his job for refusing to use pronouns of a transgender patient in a hypothetical scenario is now appealing his case.

title: Joran van der Sloot leaves Peruvian prison, headed to airport before being handed to FBI
description: Joran van der Sloot left a Peruvian prison and is headed to the Lima airport, where he'll be transferred to the FBI's custody and taken to the United States.

title: ‘Yellowstone’ star Lainey Wilson reveals why she kept romance with former NFL player a secret for over 2 years
description: Lainey Wilson revealed that Devlin "Duck" Hodges has been her boyfriend for 2.5 years and explained why they decided recently to go public with their relationship.

title: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker approves state's $50.4 billion budget for next year
description: JB Pritzker, the governor of Illinois, signed a $50.4 billion budget for next year into law on June 7, 2023. The budget focuses on education in the state.

title: Connecticut father 'infuriated' with school officials over Pride video: 'Straw that broke the camel's back'
description: Dad Kyle Reyes says he removed his children from the Granby School District's "indoctrination" agenda following a gender identity video shown without parental consent.

title: 1 dead, 4 injured in Rhode Island after car plows into Subway restaurant
description: Police in Rhode Island say one person has been killed and four were injured Wednesday when a car drove into a Subway restaurant in Greenville.

title: Portland bans daytime homeless camping
description: The city council of Portland, Oregon, has voted to pass a measure banning homeless people from camping in public areas during the daytime.

title: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton hires prominent lawyer for impeachment trial
description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton has hired prominent lawyer Tony Buzbee to represent him in his impeachment trial. The trial is set to begin no later than Aug. 28. 2023.

title: Newsom proposes constitutional amendment to restrict gun rights
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom is proposing a 28th Amendment to the Constitution that would curb gun rights without abolishing the Second Amendment.

title: Southern US farmers adapt to warm winter with new agricultural techniques, crops
description: Farmers in the Southern United States had to adapt, by using new methods and growing new crops, after one of the warmer winters in the history of the region.

title: Salmonella outbreak in Chicago linked to ground beef, according to Illinois Department of Public Health
description: According to the Illinois Department of Public Health, a salmonella outbreak in Chicago has been linked to ground beef. Health officials confirmed 26 cases in Cook, Illinois.

title: Jennifer Aniston admits she used to feel 'broken or in pain' from overdoing workouts
description: Jennifer Aniston is sharing how monotonous workouts eventually "broke" her body, and how she now maintains a healthy lifestyle.

title: Syrian refugee injures 4 children, adult in knife attack in French Alps town: report
description: French President Emmanuel Macron said Thursday that a stabbing spree in Annecy, which has left multiple young children injured, is an “attack of absolute cowardice."

title: MSNBC host Stephanie Ruhle interrupts former Congressman in inflation battle: 'Hold on, please'
description: MSNBC host Stephanie Ruhle interrupted former Republican Congressman Will Hurd on her show Wednesday during a heated debate on inflation and the economy.

title: Photos: Canadian Wildfires Turns The Big Apple Orange
Another Biden campaign co-chair has ties to Hunter, asked for his briefing ‘on the Ukraine’
description: Rep. Lisa Blunt Rochester, D-Del., is the second national co-chair for President Biden's re-election campaign to have past ties to Hunter Biden.

title: Biden administration under fire for Iran nuke and hostage deal that could net regime billions
description: Reports claim a controversial nuclear and hostage deal between Iran’s regime and the U.S. is just around the corner. The plan could inject as much as $17 billion into Iranian coffers.

title: Walt Disney axes 75 jobs at Pixar, including execs behind box office bomb ‘Lightyear’: Reuters
description: Disney's recent economic woes appear to continue as the company has reportedly booted a large wave of employees from Pixar, some of whom were executives.

title: Cavinder twins make WWE television debut
description: The Cavinder twins long hinted about making a run into WWE, and they made their television debut on the promotion on Wednesday night's NXT.

title: Fentanyl test strips being legalized across country in an effort to combat overdose deaths
description: Fentanyl test strips are becoming legal in more states as overdoses from the deadly substance continue to be an issue. Nearly 70% of the overdoses in 2022 could be linked to fentanyl.

title: Investigation results over the cause of Colorado’s worst wildfire to be revealed
description: Authorities plan to reveal the findings of an investigation into the cause of Colorado's 2021 Marshall Fire, the state's most destructive wildfire in history.

title: Australian man sentenced to 9 years in 1988 death of gay American man after 35-year battle for justice
description: Scott Phillip White has been sentenced to nine years in prison for fatally punching a gay American off a cliff in Sydney, Australia, in 1988.

title: Hazardous haze spreads across the East Coast, Biden stands firm on student loan handout and more top headlines
description: CLEARING THE AIR - National Weather Service offers grim prediction on when smoky haze engulfing much of the Northeast will end

title: Woke 'New York Times for Kids' delivers radical gender, racial politics to children
description: A colorful subsection of The New York Times is written for children, but parents may be wary of the radical gender-related rhetoric it often contains.

title: CNN’s crybabies chase out Licht for the crime of being more neutral
description: CNN’s crybabies chase out Licht for the crime of being more neutral. Trump town hall, unfavorable profile help whining staffers fire their network boss.

title: Instagram algorithm boosts ‘vast pedophile network,' bombshell report claims
description: A bombshell Wall Street Journal report revealed that Instagram algorithms help connect and promote a "vast network" of pedophilia accounts.

title: Nikki Haley vows to cut Biden’s ‘disastrous’ energy policies, increase US oil production
description: GOP presidential candidate Nikki Haley is set to unveil her energy plan if voted into office, which includes bolstering U.S. oil production and an emphasis on strong foreign policy.

title: Israeli official blasts Kamala Harris' criticism of judicial reform, says she can't 'name one' provision
description: A new clash has erupted between the Biden administration and Israel over the Jewish state’s judicial reforms, with Vice President Harris wading into the diplomatic row.

title: Joran van der Sloot to face US justice system 18 years after Natalee Holloway's disappearance in Aruba
description: Prime suspect Joran van der Sloot will be temporarily transferred to the U.S. to face charges over 18 years after Natalee Holloway went missing during a high school senior trip.

title: Alleged 'incel' Bryan Kohberger took front-row seat at 'Handmaid's Tale' author Margaret Atwood lecture
description: University of Idaho murders suspect Bryan Kohberger was pictured in a front-row seat at a Margaret Atwood lecture at Northampton Community College in 2018.

title: LGBTQ+ groups wreck Target for having no 'cojones' as some prepare boycott: 'Just stay out of it'
description: Target Corporation faces heat from LGBTQ+ advocacy organizations, some who said they may boycott the company if it refused to fix its mistakes during Pride Month.

title: Cartel slaughters 8 call center workers after they tried to quit jobs running phone scam: report
description: As many as eight young Mexican workers are confirmed dead after U.S. authorities say they attempted to quit their jobs at a call center run by a Mexican drug cartel

title: Pope's abdominal surgery 'went well,' recovering in hospital, Vatican says
description: The Vatican said that Pope Francis' recovery is going well after a 3-hour-long surgery to repair a hernia in his abdominal wall. The pope underwent surgery in Rome, Italy.

title: Moms for Liberty co-founder torches SPLC's 'extremist' label: 'We're not going to stop'
description: Tiffany Justice, a co-founder of Moms for Liberty, speaks out after the Southern Poverty Law Center labeled the parental rights organization as an 'extremist' group.

title: Tupac receives star on Hollywood Walk of Fame days before what would be his 52nd birthday
description: Late rapper Tupac Shakur's star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame was revealed on June 7. His younger sister, Sekyima, accepted the star on behalf of the family and his estate.

title: Rural Oregon movement to join 'Greater Idaho' gains traction with vote in 12th county
description: A “Greater Idaho" measure on Wallowa County in Oregon seceding to Idaho managed to avoid a recount after special election results were released on Tuesday.

title: Massive NATO air drill to simulate attack on member nation: 'our red line'
description: NATO to launch its largest-ever air drills over Germany on Monday in a stimulated response to an attack on an alliance member.

title: AI should require license like medical, nuclear work on advanced tools: Britain's Labour Party
description: Britain should prohibit technology developers from working on advanced AI tools unless they have a license to do so, according to the British Labour Party.

title: US National Weather Service warns smoky haze likely to persist for days across the US, Canada
description: A meteorologist with the National Weather Service said the thick, hazardous haze effecting millions of people in Canada and the United States will be here until the winds shifts.

title: Courtroom disaster pits Prince Harry against himself
description: Courtroom disaster pits Prince Harry against himself. His quest for victimhood and attention lands him in court, but he should have followed the royal rule.

title: Oklahoma approves first taxpayer-funded religious school, setting stage for legal battles
description: The Oklahoma State School Board voted on Monday 3-2 to approve an application by the Catholic Archdiocese of Oklahoma City to establish an online faith-based tax-payer funded school.

title: Chris Licht’s CNN ousting paves way for trio of Jeff Zucker-era holdovers to satisfy staffers
description: A trio of Jeff Zucker-era executives will help lead CNN on an interim basis after the firing of embattled CEO Chris Licht this week.

title: Biden speaks with Canadian prime minister, offers additional support in wake of historic wildfires
description: President Biden offered additional resources to Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau as wildfires rage through the country, prompting air quality alerts across America.

title: Sucralose, a chemical in Splenda, is found to cause ‘significant health effects’ in new study
description: Sucralose, a chemical found in the popular zero-calorie sweetener Splenda, has been shown to cause damage to DNA, raise the risk of cancer and cause leaks in the gut lining, per a new study.

title: Prince Harry's UK court fight: Experts reveal if emotional prince revisiting his 'tortured' past was a mistake
description: Prince Harry, the Duke of Sussex, faced two days of cross examination at London's High Court during his legal battle against Mirror Group Newspapers.

title: ChatGPT shows one dangerous flaw when responding to health crisis questions, study finds
description: When ChatGPT was asked for help with public health issues — such as addiction, sexual assault and suicidal tendencies — the AI chatbot did not provide referrals to appropriate resources.

title: Chinese dominance in AI would result in 'no freedom, no representative government' warn experts
description: China and the U.S. have been developing AI at a rapid pace that has evolved into a race for dominance, but should China surpass U.S. in its technological capability, experts warn of dire consequences.

title: AI in Hollywood: Crowd-created film allows fans to design generative art, work with studio on creative process
description: The studio OneDoor has brought fans and AI artists into the creative process of the new film "Calculated" to create concept art, storyboards and more.

title: AI arms race will dominate 2024 election
description: AI arms race will dominate 2024 election as campaigns maximize use of new artificial intelligence technology. Results will show the strengths of the tech.

title: Canada celebrates annual Clean Air Day, as fires continue to ravage northeastern US
description: Canada recognized it's annual Clean Air Day as hundreds of wildfires continue to destroy parts of the country and pour a smoky, yellow haze into parts of northeastern U.S.

title: Biden vetoes bill cancelling his $400 billion student loan handout, vows he's 'not going to back down'
description: President Biden vetoed a bill that would scrap his $400 billion student loan handout while railing against Republicans for supporting "huge tax cuts for corporations and the wealthy."

title: LAURA INGRAHAM: Democrats' strategy is to smear anyone and everyone who gets in their way
description: Fox News host Laura Ingraham explains why Democrats loosely use the words 'racism' and 'White supremacy' on 'The Ingraham Angle.'

title: Madeline Kingsbury’s family says ‘right person in custody’ after ex arrested
description: Madeline's Kinsbury's family said that they believe the "right person is in custody" following the arrest of the missing mother's former partner and father of her two children.

title: On this day in history, June 8, 1969, Mickey Mantle's No. 7 is retired by the New York Yankees
description: Yankee slugger Mickey Mantle had his No. 7 retired on this day in history, June 8, 1969, before 61,000 fans in Yankee Stadium. He spent his entire 18-year baseball career with the New York Yankees.
